H0.text: Trisomy 21 is the most common cause of Down syndrome.

H1.text: Trisomy 22 is the most common cause of Down syndrome.

H2.text: Gametes 21 are the most common cause of Down syndrome.

H3.text: Chromosome 21 is the most common cause of Down syndrome.

A4.text: Trisomy 21: 94% of the time Down syndrome is caused by an extra copy of chromosome 21 in all cells,

A5.text: The most common cause (about 92â€“95% of cases) is a complete extra copy of chromosome 21, resulting in trisomy 21.

A6.text: Down syndrome or Down's syndrome, also known as trisomy 21, is a genetic disorder caused by the presence of all or part of a third copy of chromosome 21.

A7.text: The parents of the affected individual are usually genetically normal.
